name: Political rights
description: Ratings are determined by the total number of points each country receives for 10 questions associated with political rights. countries receive 0-4 points for each question with zero points indicating the least degree of freedom and four points the greatest degree. an overall score between 1-7 is then computed where a country is deemed to be free if it scores between 1 and 2.5, partially free with a score between 3 and 5, and not free with a score between 5.5 and 7.

name: P8) Are internet intermediaries (such as internet service providers, web hosting companies, cyber cafes, search engines or internet access providers) clearly protected from legal liability for unlawful content created, stored or disseminated by their users?
Mobile phone subscriptions per 100 population
description: Refers to the subscriptions to a mobile cellular telephone service, including number of pre-paid sim cards active during the past three months, divided by the population and multipled by 100.

name: Wikipedia articles in local language
description: Number of wikipedia articles in local language (taking end-year values). local language data is sourced from the cia which mainly draws on national census data and ethnologue which provides a database of academic studies. the number of articles in each relevant language is weighted by the share of the population that speak that language.

name: Free and Open
I1) To what extent has open data had a noticeable impact on increasing government efficiency and effectiveness?
Freedom & Openness
Universal Access
Secondary enrolment rates (gross)
S2) To what extent are health workers in the public sector trained on the use of ICTs to improve health outcomes to poor and marginalised communities?
I4) To what extent has open data had a noticeable impact on increasing the inclusion of marginalised groups in policy making and accessing government services?
S13) To what extent has the government implemented concrete targets for gender equity in ICT access and use?
S9). To what extent have web-powered ICTs made a noticeable impact on the ability of women and girls to claim and demand their rights?
I3) To what extent has open data had a noticeable impact on environmental sustainability in the country?
Secure internet servers per million people
description: Servers using encryption technology in transactions divided by population multiplied by 1,000,000.

name: Economic Impact
Percentage of individuals using the internet
description: Refers to the percentage of the population using the internet. the internet is a worldwide public computer network. it provides access to a number of communication services including the world wide web and carries e-mail, news, entertainment and data files. internet use may be facilitated by any device enabling internet access (not only a computer). this includes a mobile phone, pda, games machine and digital tv. use can be via a fixed or mobile network.

name: Ict use and government efficiency
description: Survey question: to what extent has the use of information and communication technologies by the government improved the efficiency of government services in your country? [1 = no effect; 7 = has generated considerable improvement].

name: P9) To what extent are there laws and regulations in your country that provide both substantive and procedural safeguards to protect the privacy of electronic communications?
Government online services index
description: Assesses the quality, relevance and usefulness of government websites for providing online information and participatory tools and services for people.

name: A13) Are there specific policies to promote free or low-cost public internet access, such as budget allocations for internet access in public libraries, schools and community centers, or provisions for spectrum use by community wi-fi options?
Impact of ict on organisational models
description: Survey question: to what extent are information and communication technologies creating new organisational models (virtual teams, remote working, telecommuting etc) within businesses in your country? [1 = not at all; 7 = significantly].

name: P2) To what extent do major CSOs use Web-powered ICTs to educate and inform citizens about government decision-making and public policy issues?
S1) To what extent are ICTs being used to improve health outcomes among poor and marginalised groups?
S7) To what extent are Web-powered ICTs used by government agencies and/or CSOs to increase environmental awareness of individuals and promote behavioural change?

P7) To what extent are ISPs required by law or regulations to manage network traffic in a manner that is transparent and does not discriminate against certain types and/or providers of web content and services for commercial gain?
Access and Affordability
Content and use
Freedom of the press
I5) To what extent has open data had a noticeable positive impact on the economy?
Internet access in schools
description: Survey question: how would you rate the level of access to the internet in schools in your country? [1 = very limited; 7 = extensive].

name: Index
Political Impact
S11) To what extent are web-powered ICTs being used by government or non-government organisations (NGOs or private sector) to support victims of gender-based violence?
Mobile-cellular sub-basket as a % of monthly gdp per capita
description: This a composite indicator calculated by itu to quantify the affordability of mobile-cellular correspondance. technically, it sums the price of 30 outgoing calls (peak, off-peak, on-net and off-net) plus 100 sms messages and expresses it as a share of monthly gdp per capita.

name: S10) To what extent can women and girls find user friendly information via web-powered ICTs about reproductive and sexual health rights and services?
S8) To what extent has campaigning through web-powered ICT platforms by the main CSOs played a role in encouraging members of the public to take social or political action on environmental concerns?
S6) To what extent can smallholder farmers discover information (for free) that could affect their livelihoods using their mobile phones or other Web-powered ICT platforms?
S4) To what extent are teachers and administrators receiving appropriate training in how to use ICTs to improve education outcomes?
Ixps
Broadband subscribers per 100 population
description: Refers to total fixed (wired) broadband internet subscriptions (that is, subscriptions to high-speed access to the public internet (a tcp/ip connection) at downstream speeds equal to, or greater than 256 kbit/s) divided by population and multiplied by 100.

name: S3) To what extent are ICTs being used to improve education outcomes for poor and marginalised communities?
Relevant Content & Use
S5). To what extent are web-powered ICTs contributing to the growth of small and medium enterprises (SMEs)?
Communications Infrastructure
S12) To what extent are law enforcement agencies and the courts taking action in cases where ICT tools are used to commit acts of gender-based violence?
Civil liberties
description: Ratings are determined by the total number of points each country receives for 15 questions associated with civil liberties. countries receive 0-4 points for each question with zero points indicating the least degree of freedom and four points the greatest degree. an overall score between 1-7 is then computed where a country is deemed to be free if it scores between 1 and 2.5, partially free with a score between 3 and 5, and not free with a score between 5.5 and 7.

name: Education and awareness
Social and environmental Impact
I6) To what extent are entrepreneurs successfully using open data to build new businesses in the country?
P5) To what extent is there a robust legal or regulatory framework for protection of personal data in your country?
E-participation index
description: Index score measuring the extent of web use to facilitate provision of information by governments to citizens, interaction with stakeholders and engagment in decision-making processes.

name: P4) To what extent has the government blocked (or required ICT firms to block, filter or take down) politically or socially sensitive Web content during the past 12 months?
Dominant social network monthly active users
International bandwidth (mbits/second) per internet user
description: Capacity of all internet exchanges that backbone operaters provide to carry traffic. based on responses from countries of an annual questionnaire supplemented with data from itu research. measured in terms of mbits per second per internet user.

name: P10) To what extent does the law protect people from crimes committed over the Internet (i.e. do the laws exist and are they enforced)?
I2) To what extent has open data had a noticeable impact on increasing transparency and accountability in the country?
Fixed broadband internet monthly subscription as % of monthly gdp per capita
description: The monthly subscription charge for fixed (wired) broadband internet service. fixed (wired) broadband is considered any dedicated connection to the internet at downstream speeds equal to, or greater than, 256 kbit/s, using dsl. where several offers are available, preference should be given to the 256 kbit/s connection. taxes should be included. if not included, it should be specified in a note including the applicable tax rate. this indicator is expressed in us$ as a share of monthly gdp per capita.

name: P6). To what extent does the country have a functioning Right to Information (RTI) / Freedom of Information (FoI) law?
Percentage of population covered by mobile cellular network
Literacy rates
description: Defined as the percentage of the population aged 15 and over who can with understanding read/write a short simple statement about their everyday life.

name: Innovation index
Press freedom index
description: Score based on questionnaire filled out by independent sources. questions cover violations affecting journalists (murder, imprisonment etc) and news media (censorship, confiscation of newspaper issues) plus the degree of self-censorship i.e. the ability of the media to investigate and criticise. also takes into account the legal and economic status of the media (state monopoly, private monopoly etc).

name: Empowerment
P3) Over the past year, to what extent have web-powered ICTs been used to catalyse social or political action?
Broadband speed
C1) To what extent is there a well-resourced open government data initiative in this country?
